messages.content:
I have this information
"""Call for Offer

Climate Consultant Expert

1. INTRODUCTION
Five One Labs is an international startup incubator that helps talented entrepreneurs from
diverse communities launch their startups. Through our innovative multi-lingual
programming, we provide intensive training, mentorship, funding, and advisory support to
scalable startups looking to launch or grow their businesses.
Five One Labs creates flexible programs for early-stage and aspiring entrepreneurs that are
focused on human-centered design, the core building blocks of business fundamentals, and
leadership development.
Five One Labs is a registered non-profit organization both in the US and the Kurdistan
Region of Iraq.

For more information, please visit www.fiveonelabs.org
1.1 Five One Labs invites one or several qualified Climate Consultant Experts to submit
their bids to integrate climate resilience practices into the standard Incubator program
curriculum for its future green program. This upgrade will equip entrepreneurs with the tools
and knowledge needed to address environmental challenges while building sustainable
businesses. This enhancement will foster innovation in green solutions, align with global
sustainability goals, and position the program as a leader in climate-focused
entrepreneurship in KRI. By embedding these practices, Five One Labs ensures its
participants are prepared to create impactful, future-ready businesses that contribute to
economic growth and environmental resilience.

The services are expected to commence in January 2025.
1.2 These Instructions are intended to help bidders prepare their offer.

1.3 Bidders will not be reimbursed for any costs incurred in connection with the preparation
and submission of their offer.
1.4 Five One Labs reserves the right to select bidders who are technically more suitable for
delivering the services, even if they do not offer the lowest price.
1.5 Five One Labs reserves the right to select multiple bidders based on their areas of
expertise and the geographic location of the services provided.
1.6 All correspondence, documentation, certification, and previous similar services shall be
in the English language, and the other registration documents shall be in Arabic / Kurdish
language.
2. TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
2.1 The offer must be submitted before Sunday, January 19, 2025, at 1:00 pm (Iraqi time) and
must include all the service details specified below Instructions. In case you cannot provide any
of the services please refer to it in a comment as “cannot provide”.
Please submit your bid along with all the documentation by email to the following address:
haval@fiveonelabs.org
shwan@fiveonelabs.org
savo@fiveonelabs.org
2.2 Proposal based on the below minimum requirement.
Any additional service packages/offers are to be added in a separate document
(annex)

No. Description Requirement

1 Contract
duration and
activities details:

Approximate start date - January 21 - February 25, 2025.
Activity Details:
● The current Incubator curriculum is structured around three
key pillars: design, build, and leadership. These areas
focus on helping entrepreneurs conceptualize, develop, and
implement their business ideas while fostering strong

leadership skills to effectively guide their ventures. The
program delivers these objectives through 32
comprehensive sessions, covering topics such as business
model design, financial planning, market research, and team
management, all tailored to meet the unique needs of
early-stage business owners.

2 Service location A Remote Service.

3 Main Duties ● The Climate Consultant Expert will be responsible for
reviewing these sessions in detail and identifying
opportunities to integrate climate resilience concepts. This
includes:
○ Incorporating Climate Resilience Practices:
Embedding strategies for sustainable business
practices and environmental awareness into existing
topics, ensuring they are seamlessly aligned with the
curriculum’s overall goals.
○ Providing Practical Examples: Enriching the
sessions with live case studies and examples from
local or international companies that demonstrate
successful climate resilience initiatives.
○ Customizing Content: Tailoring climate-related
elements to be relevant to the local context in KRI,
while drawing inspiration from global best practices to
ensure participants gain a broad and balanced
perspective.
○ Preparing Materials in Multiple Languages:
Ensuring that all developed materials are prepared in
English, Arabic, and Kurdish to ensure accessibility
and inclusivity for all participants, accommodating
linguistic diversity in the region.
○ Trainer Support Materials: Provide detailed notes
and sources of information for each part of the
curriculum to assist the Five One Labs trainer in
delivering the sessions smoothly. This should include
key talking points, relevant case studies, visual aids,
and a list of credible sources or references for further
reading and research

4 Educational
Background

● A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Environmental Science,
Climate Science, Meteorology, Sustainability, Environmental
Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience in
climate consulting or environmental management. Additional
certifications or coursework in climate risk assessment,
renewable energy, environmental policy, or sustainability
practices is a plus.

5 Professional
Qualifications

● Work experience in climate consultancy, environmental
research, or sustainability projects, particularly related to
climate risk assessments, climate change mitigation, and
adaptation.
● Hands-on involvement in climate adaptation strategies, green
building designs, or sustainable energy solutions.
● Experience in creating educational content, including curricula
for climate change education or environmental sustainability
programs.
● Collaboration with educational institutions or NGOs to design
training programs that raise awareness about climate change,
environmental science, or green technologies.
● Leading or working within climate-focused startups or
businesses in renewable energy, sustainable agriculture, or
environmental consulting.
● Business strategy development and sustainability initiatives
within an entrepreneurial framework, combining
environmental goals with economic success.
● Developing online courses or workshops on environmental
topics, climate resilience, or sustainable business practices.
● Involvement in workshop facilitation or creating learning
resources for diverse audiences

6 Interpersonal
Skills

● Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively
with Five One Labs' Start-up Support team, fostering a
positive and productive working environment.
● Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability
to convey ideas, provide constructive feedback, and engage
with diverse stakeholders.
● Fluent in English, Arabic, and Kurdish, with the ability to
communicate seamlessly across these languages to ensure

inclusivity and effective communication in a multilingual
environment

7 Payment A one-time payment will be made upon completion of the
deliverables outlined below. The total payment will be based on the
agreed-upon scope of work, as detailed in the requirements.
Payments can be made via bank letter or bank transfer.
Deliverables:
● Develop and integrate climate resilience practices into the
standard incubator program curriculum for the future green
program.
● Prepare the developed curriculum materials in English,
Arabic, and Kurdish to ensure accessibility for a diverse
range of entrepreneurs.
● Tailor climate resilience strategies and sustainability practices
to the specific needs and challenges of locals, while ensuring
the content remains globally relevant by drawing inspiration
from international best practices.
● Provide detailed notes and sources of information for each
part of the curriculum to assist the Five One Labs trainer in
delivering the sessions smoothly. This should include key
talking points, relevant case studies, visual aids, and a list of
credible sources or references for further reading and
research

3. GENERAL REMARKS AND SPECIAL CONDITIONS
3.1 The bidder must offer the price inclusive of all taxes applicable.
3.2 The bidder must provide a lump sum price for the complete scope of required services.
3.3 Any bids submitted after the specified deadline will not be considered.
3.4 Prices must be submitted in IQD.
3.5 Five One Labs will not be responsible for covering any additional expenses.
3.6 Received offers will be considered as a final quotation from the bidders.

3.7 Five One Labs reserves the full rights to select and sign service work contracts with one
or multiple bidders.
3.8 Criteria for contract award will be based on:
● Technical Qualifications
● Price of the bid
● Terms of payment
● Quality of service
● Flexibility
3.7 Currency and Payment:
Bidders should quote prices in IQD only.
● As Five One Labs is not tax-exempted in Federal Iraq, therefore, all prices have
to be given inclusive of all applicable taxes.
● All payments will be done in IQD by bank letter or bank transfer, at the discretion
of the Contracting Authority.
● Bidders must propose the best payment conditions possible.
● Service fees will be post-paid. Five One Labs shall not make any advance payments
prior to receiving the service/s.

4. Price Table

# Description of Service Unit Rate (IQD)
1 Integrate climate resilience practices into the standard
Incubator program curriculum in English, Arabic, and"""

And this information
"""Curriculum Outlines

Part I. Ignite Program (Pre-Incubator)
1. Design thinking:
● Program Overview
● Design thinking process and plan
2. User research:
● User persona
● Empathy map
3. The survey:
● Steps to creating a survey
● Survey component
● How to get respondents
4. Market research:
● Understand your market
● Market analyses and market size
● Competitive benchmarking
5. Reframe:
● Analyze user research
● Custom journey steps and map
● Build your business
6. Creativity and ideation:
● Rapid brainstorming (what if?)
● Idea filtrati
● Challenging assumption
7. The pitch:
● Storytelling
● Know your audience
● Pitch key points
● Judging criteria
8. Your brand:
● Build a brand
● New value proposition
● Mission and values

1

Part II. Incubator Program
1. Introduction, Recap & Goal Setting
● Welcome & Introductions
● Five One Labs & The Incubator
● Ignite Recap & Goal Setting
2. Intro to UX
● Reflect on CJM and why it is importan
● Map out the ideal customer journey or “happy path” for your business.
● Identify areas of opportunity that we will use when developing your business model.
3. BMC-Business Model Canvas
● Understand the various parts of the Business Model Canvas (BMC).
● Fill in the parts of your own business model.
● Identify assumptions you are making about your business model.
4. Introduction to prototyping
● Understand why prototyping is essential to product development.
● Review the different types of prototypes to create a prototyping plan.
● Create your first prototype
5. Test and Iterate
● Learn and apply the best practices to test your prototype.
● Test your prototypes and plan for the next iterations.
● Begin to iterate on your prototypes.
6. Revenue Model
● Understand and compare various revenue models.
● Make a plan to test your revenue model.
● Begin to forecast possible revenues.
7. UX Design Principles
● Review good and bad UX design examples.
● Understand elements of great UX design that you can apply to your business.
● Apply key UX principles to your business.
8. Project Management
● Understand what goes into managing a project.
● Introduce some tools that can support you and your team as you develop your business.
● Break down your goals and create a system to meet them.
9. Cost Model
● Break down the different types of business costs.
● Forecast ongoing business costs.
● Build out the next step of your P&L statement.

2

10. Balance Sheet
● Include your start-up budget in your finance
● Get to know the balance sheet and begin making one.
● Understand how finances change with investments or loan
11. Service Design
● Examine the various layers of your product or service.
● Understand what goes into good service.
● Identify opportunities to provide great service to your customers.
12. The Pitch Recap:
● Recap pitching best practices
● Go over the pitch criteria and details for the next competition
● Update your pitch deck and practice in front of your peers!
13. User Interface (UI)
● Understand why UI is important,
● Put your product through the 10 rules of UI,
● Identify ways to improve the look and feel of your product.
14. Graphic Design & Communications
● Understand different elements of graphic design.
● Practice using Canva as a design tool.
● Create marketing materials for your business
15. Continuous Innovation
● Understand the importance of innovation in the startup world.
● Develop concrete ideas to create a more innovative company.
● Use the Innovation Mission Map to identify your innovation focus and strategy.
16. Record Keeping
● Pinpoint the things you should be tracking,
● Practice using some very basic tools to record income and expenses.
● Create a customer relationship management (CRM) system.
17. Introduction to LEAD
● Define leadership and understand who can be a leade
● Understand the difference between managers and Leaders and the roles they play in an
organization.
● Understand different leadership styles and how to apply them in varying contexts.
18. Personal Brand + Networking
● Understand the importance of having a strong personal brand.
● Define how you create value for others in your lif
● Create or improve your LinkedIn account and build your network.

3

19. Marketing Strategy
● Understand different elements of a marketing strategy.
● Define your marketing pla
● Evaluate marketing strategies by calculating customer acquisition costs.
20. Hiring a Team
● Understand the importance of hiring the right team.
● Review who should be on YOUR team.
● Start the process of recruiting, interviewing, and hiring your first employee
21. Identifying Organizational Gaps
● Identify the skills and knowledge gaps in your business.
● Learn how to fill gaps by building strong partnership
● Create a plan to build partnerships based on your business needs.
22. Sales
● Understand the “get, keep, grow” model as a sales framework.
● Brainstorm some ways to increase sales over time.
● Start to develop your sales channels.
23. Business Plan
● Understand what should be included in a business plan.
● Review examples of great business plans.
● Begin to create your business plan.
24. Being a Manager
● Learn how to create better performance through a strong team.
● Understand how to give constructive feedback to best support employees and teammates.
● Learn key management skills including how to conduct team meetings and delegate.
25. Supply Chain
● Experience a rapid product development process.
● Understand the different parts of your supply chain.
● Evaluate how to add value along your supply chain.
26. Negotiation
● Learn the principles of interest-based negotiation,
● Understand how to prepare for a negotiation,
● Learn how to broker wise agreements with others.
27. Business Ethics
● Establish a clear understanding of what business ethics is.
● Identify ways to include the triple bottom line into your business model
● Formulate a plan to create and measure impact.
28. Communication
● Explore your own style of communication.
● Be a better leader by understanding verbal, nonverbal and written communication.
● Learn steps to make our communication more effective.

4

29. Financing Alternatives
● Understand typical startup financing option
● Identify local financing alternatives that you can us
● Create an alternate post-incubation go-to-market strategy
30. Risk and Crisis Management
● Reflect on your decision-making style, and pinpoint strengths and weaknesse
● Set an initial risk management strategy and learn how to adapt it over time.
● Learn a few strategies to adapt when you are in a crisis.
31. Investment in the Middle East
● Go over some entrepreneurship and tech trends around the world and in the MENA region.
● Identify challenges and opportunities in the region and place your business in the current
context.
● Discuss the different key actors in the region and brainstorm ways to work with the current
players.
32. Mindsets
● Understand the various parts of the Business Model Canvas (BMC).
● Fill in the parts of your own business model.
● Identify assumptions you are making about your business model."""

If I want to apply this job, what kind of proposal I need to prepare?

**Navigating job application**

I’m thinking through the job call and curriculum together to highlight the necessary skills and experiences in the proposal. This ensures it’s well-suited for the climate consultant position.

**Preparing your proposal**

I’m organizing the submission by including technical qualifications, pricing, payment terms, and service quality. The deadline is set for January 19, 2025, at 1 PM (Iraqi time).

Below is a suggested structure and key content for a strong proposal in response to Five One Labs’ Call for Offer for a Climate Consultant Expert. You want to ensure your proposal clearly demonstrates your understanding of the project requirements, your relevant expertise, and how you plan to integrate climate resilience practices into their existing startup curriculum. 

---

## 1. Cover Letter

**Purpose**: Provide an introduction and express your interest in the project.

- **Header/Title**: “Proposal for Climate Consultant Expert Services”
- **Salutation**: Address to Five One Labs (you may list key contacts such as “Dear Haval, Shwan, and Savo” if desired).
- **Brief Introduction**: Introduce yourself/your organization, your expertise, and your interest in contributing to Five One Labs’ green program.
- **Summary of Qualification**: In 2–3 lines, highlight your key climate- and sustainability-related qualifications and prior relevant experiences.

---

## 2. Executive Summary

**Purpose**: Give an at-a-glance overview of the proposal contents.

- **Project Understanding**: Show that you’ve read and understood the main aims—namely, integrating climate resilience and sustainability practices into the Incubator Program’s 32-session curriculum.
- **Key Contributions**: Summarize the specific ways you will support Five One Labs, such as reviewing existing modules, embedding climate-related practices, and developing multilingual materials.
- **Outcomes**: Emphasize the practical impact—how your work will enable entrepreneurs to develop sustainable, climate-resilient businesses.

---

## 3. Technical Approach & Methodology

**Purpose**: Detail exactly **how** you will fulfill the scope of work.

1. **Curriculum Review**  
   - State how you will examine Five One Labs’ current Ignite and Incubator curriculum (the 32 sessions).  
   - Mention specific steps or frameworks you’ll use to identify entry points for climate resilience elements (e.g., “I will map each session’s learning objectives against recognized climate adaptation/mitigation strategies”).

2. **Integrating Climate Resilience Concepts**  
   - Show how you will adapt topics like business model design, market research, user research, etc. to include sustainability and climate resilience practices.  
   - Indicate whether you’ll use case studies (local and international), scenario planning, etc.

3. **Material Development**  
   - Indicate how you will prepare the final materials in **English, Arabic, and Kurdish** (a key requirement).  
   - Describe how you’ll format these materials (slides, written guides, trainer notes) and ensure accessibility for a diverse audience.

4. **Trainer Support & Notes**  
   - Outline your plan to create trainer guides: e.g., “For each session, I will provide bullet points, references, case studies, and visual aids.”  
   - Emphasize how these notes will help Five One Labs staff deliver sessions confidently.

5. **Local Context + Global Best Practices**  
   - Show how you’ll align climate practices to the local realities in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KRI), while also bringing in relevant global frameworks (SDGs, net-zero strategies, green entrepreneurship trends, etc.).

6. **Feedback Loop**  
   - Clarify if you will conduct check-ins or virtual review sessions with Five One Labs staff to ensure alignment and address questions before finalizing materials.

---

## 4. Work Plan & Timeline

**Purpose**: Demonstrate your organizational approach and ensure timely delivery.

- **Approximate Start**: January 21, 2025, per the Call for Offer.
- **End Date**: February 25, 2025 (or the final date you expect to complete deliverables).
- **Phases & Milestones** (sample breakdown):
  1. **Phase 1: Curriculum Review** (Week 1)
  2. **Phase 2: Outline of Climate Integration** (Week 2)
  3. **Phase 3: Drafting Materials (English)** (Week 3)
  4. **Phase 4: Translation into Arabic & Kurdish** (Week 4)
  5. **Phase 5: Final Revisions & Handover** (Week 5)
- **Deliverables**:
  - Draft integrated curriculum in English
  - Translated curriculum in Arabic and Kurdish
  - Trainer notes and references
  - Final presentation or review session with Five One Labs (if required)

---

## 5. Your Qualifications & Team

**Purpose**: Demonstrate that your background/experience matches the job requirements.

1. **Educational Background**  
   - Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Environmental Science, Sustainability, or related fields.  
   - If you have additional certifications (renewable energy, policy, etc.), list them here.

2. **Professional Experience**  
   - Highlight relevant climate resilience or sustainability consulting projects.  
   - Emphasize any experience designing curricula or training programs.  
   - Showcase any prior entrepreneurial/incubator experiences if possible.

3. **Language Proficiency**  
   - Confirm fluency in English, Arabic, and Kurdish (if you personally or your team members can provide this).  
   - If you will work with translators or a multilingual team, mention how you will ensure quality control across languages.

4. **Interpersonal & Collaboration Skills**  
   - Demonstrate past collaborations with NGOs, startups, or educational institutions.  
   - Stress communication and teamwork capabilities.

5. **Team Composition** (if you have a team)  
   - Short bios of key personnel (including roles and responsibilities).  
   - Link each person’s experience to their tasks in the project.

---

## 6. Budget & Pricing

**Purpose**: Provide clear pricing in **IQD** as requested.

1. **Lump Sum**  
   - State a single comprehensive fee that covers all your proposed services (including taxes, translations, references, etc.).  
   - For clarity, you can include a brief cost breakdown (e.g., research, translations, final production) but emphasize that the final total is all-inclusive.

2. **Payment Terms**  
   - Acknowledge that Five One Labs pays *post-service*. Propose any feasible milestone-based approach *if they allow it*, or confirm your acceptance of one-time payment upon completion.  
   - Remind them how you prefer to receive payment (bank transfer, bank letter, etc.).

---

## 7. Additional Documentation (Annexes)

**Purpose**: Provide supportive evidence of your ability to deliver.

- **Annex A: Detailed Work Schedule**  
  - May include a Gantt chart or calendar view for each deliverable.
- **Annex B: Sample Curriculum Materials**  
  - If you have prior relevant work, you can attach examples (redacted, if confidential).
- **Annex C: CV or Resumés** (for you and any key team members).
- **Annex D: Reference List**  
  - Publications, articles, or prior projects that demonstrate your expertise.
- **Annex E: Testimonials or Letters of Recommendation**  
  - If you have these from previous clients, include them to demonstrate credibility.

---

## 8. Closing Statement

**Purpose**: End on a concise, professional note.

- Reiterate your enthusiasm and readiness to start on January 21, 2025.
- Invite Five One Labs to reach out if they have questions or clarifications.
- Provide full contact details (email, phone, website, LinkedIn, etc.).

---

# Final Tips

1. **Follow Submission Instructions**:  
   - Email the proposal to the **three specified email addresses** (`haval@fiveonelabs.org`, `shwan@fiveonelabs.org`, `savo@fiveonelabs.org`) before **Sunday, January 19, 2025, at 1:00 pm (Iraqi time)**.  
   - Make sure the **subject line** clearly indicates that it is a proposal for the Climate Consultant Expert role.

2. **Keep It Clear & Concise**:  
   - The proposal should be well-structured and easy to read.  
   - Use headings, bullet points, and consistent formatting.

3. **Highlight Local & Global Context**:  
   - Emphasize that you understand the unique context in the KRI region while also integrating international best practices.

4. **Ensure IQD Pricing**:  
   - They specifically request pricing in IQD, inclusive of taxes.

5. **Demonstrate Alignment with Criteria**:  
   - They will evaluate on **technical qualifications, price, payment terms, service quality, and flexibility**. Make sure each of these elements is clearly addressed.

By preparing a proposal with the above structure and focusing on how you will practically integrate climate resilience into Five One Labs’ curriculum, you will demonstrate both your technical expertise and your understanding of their needs—key to maximizing your chances of being selected. Good luck!
Based on the information provided here, can you expand more the work plan, timeline, along the lump sum. What does it look like?

**Crafting the plan**

I'm digging into the Work Plan, detailing tasks for each week. This involves time management, aligning deliverables, and crafting a clear timeline.

**Breaking down tasks**

I'm looking at a six-phase plan: Kickoff, Integration, Content Development, Translation, Final Revisions, and optional Training of Trainers. We can estimate a lump sum of around 8 million IQD for translation.

**Pinpointing the tasks**

I’m thinking through tasks week by week, considering deliverables and a generic lump sum of 4 million IQD for reference. This approach might streamline the process efficiently.

Below is an illustrative example of how you could structure and present an expanded **Work Plan, Timeline, and Lump Sum** section in your proposal. You should tailor the exact dates, tasks, and costs to your actual plan and resources, but this provides a helpful template. --- ## 4. Work Plan & Timeline **Project Duration**: January 21, 2025 – February 25, 2025 (5 weeks total) Below is a proposed schedule broken into five phases. Each phase has key tasks, target deliverables, and estimated completion dates. ### **Phase 1: Curriculum Review and Needs Assessment** **Dates**: Week 1 (January 21 – January 27, 2025) - **Tasks** 1. **Kickoff Meeting**: Meet (virtually) with the Five One Labs team to clarify scope, align on expectations, and confirm roles. 2. **Document Review**: Examine existing Ignite and Incubator curriculum (32 sessions) in detail. 3. **Gap Analysis**: Identify where climate resilience, adaptation, or mitigation concepts can seamlessly be introduced or expanded. 4. **Local Context Research**: Gather additional background on green entrepreneurship and climate challenges specific to the KRI region. - **Deliverables** - Summary document (1–2 pages) highlighting key areas for integration - Proposed approach for embedding climate concepts across the curriculum --- ### **Phase 2: Integration Outline and Content Mapping** **Dates**: Week 2 (January 28 – February 3, 2025) - **Tasks** 1. **Curriculum Integration Plan**: Develop a high-level outline showing how each of the 32 sessions can be enhanced with climate resilience topics, local case studies, and global best practices. 2. **Stakeholder Check-In**: Present the draft outline to Five One Labs staff for feedback and incorporate revisions. 3. **Finalize Session Priorities**: Determine which sessions will require the most significant changes versus minor references to sustainability. - **Deliverables** - Climate Integration Outline (detailing each session’s new objectives, learning outcomes, and key discussion points) - Updated project timeline (if any adjustments are needed) --- ### **Phase 3: Content Development (English)** **Dates**: Week 3 (February 4 – February 10, 2025) - **Tasks** 1. **Module Creation**: Draft new content for each relevant session (slides, facilitator notes, interactive exercises, local/international case studies). 2. **Resource Compilation**: Prepare short reading lists, credible references, links to external tools, and any visual aids. 3. **Trainer Support Materials**: Write detailed speaking notes, facilitator prompts, and optional activities to deepen participant engagement. - **Deliverables** - Complete draft of revised curriculum sections (in **English**) - Trainer guide/notes (in English) with references and case studies --- ### **Phase 4: Translation into Arabic & Kurdish** **Dates**: Week 4 (February 11 – February 17, 2025) - **Tasks** 1. **Professional Translation**: Translate all relevant materials (slides, handouts, trainer notes) from English into **Arabic** and **Kurdish**. 2. **Quality Review**: Ensure technical accuracy (especially for climate/scientific terminology) and consistency across all languages. 3. **Localization Adjustments**: Adapt examples and terminology if needed to ensure cultural relevance. - **Deliverables** - Finalized materials in **Arabic and Kurdish** - Combined tri-lingual package (English, Arabic, Kurdish) ready for use by Five One Labs --- ### **Phase 5: Final Revisions & Handover** **Dates**: Week 5 (February 18 – February 24, 2025) - **Tasks** 1. **Review and Editing**: Integrate any final feedback from Five One Labs, refine content, and resolve open questions. 2. **Handover Session**: Conduct a virtual review meeting or brief “training of trainers” (if requested) to walk Five One Labs’ team through the materials. 3. **Final Documentation**: Provide a consolidated package of resources, including all references, case studies, and notes. - **Deliverables** - **Final integrated climate curriculum** (English, Arabic, Kurdish) - Updated trainer notes + reference list - Completion Report (outlining achievements, lessons learned, recommendations) --- ## 7. Budget & Pricing (Lump Sum) In line with Five One Labs’ requirements, I am providing a **lump sum price in Iraqi Dinar (IQD)** inclusive of all applicable taxes, translation costs, and any other incidental expenses. Below is an example structure of how you might present your final cost. You can add or remove line items depending on your cost breakdown style. | **Description** | **Cost (IQD)** | |---------------------------------------------------|---------------:| | **Phase 1 & 2**
Curriculum Review, Gap Analysis, Integration Outline | 1,000,000 | | **Phase 3**
Content Development (English) | 1,200,000 | | **Phase 4**
Translation to Arabic & Kurdish + QA | 800,000 | | **Phase 5**
Final Revisions & Handover | 500,000 | | **TOTAL LUMP SUM** | **3,500,000 IQD** | > **Note**: > 1. The above numbers are purely illustrative. Your actual lump sum should reflect your own cost calculations. > 2. This total price includes all required taxes, translation expenses, and administrative overheads. > 3. Payment is expected upon satisfactory completion of final deliverables, with no advance payments as per Five One Labs’ policies. --- ### Payment Terms - **Payment Schedule**: One-time payment, post-completion of final deliverables (no later than February 25, 2025, unless negotiated otherwise). - **Method**: **Bank transfer** or **bank letter**, per Five One Labs’ discretion. - **Currency**: All payments will be made in **IQD**. --- ### Flexibility If Five One Labs prefers a slightly different payment schedule (e.g., one milestone payment after Phase 3 and another after Phase 5), I am open to discussing options that align with organizational policies and practical requirements. However, I acknowledge that the default arrangement is to receive payment after delivery. --- # Summary This expanded **Work Plan, Timeline, and Lump Sum** section: - Demonstrates **how** you will complete the project over a 5-week period. - Outlines **deliverables** at each phase. - Provides a **clear budget** in IQD, inclusive of taxes and translations. - Aligns with Five One Labs’ guidelines for payment terms and schedule. Feel free to adjust the breakdown of tasks, timelines, and budget figures to match your actual strategy and resources.

can you make it only up to 4 million IQD and reduce the amount of work by limiting the number of back and forths and deliverables, maybe 2 or max 3 deliverables as long as we fit into their payment terms and schedule

**Refining the plan**

Considering a budget of 4 million IQD or less, with 1 or 2 concise deliverables. Removing back-and-forth, aiming for a streamlined process.

**Refining deliverables**

Proposing a clearer structure: two main deliverables—an outline and translated materials. The process includes kickoff, content development in English, translation to Arabic and Kurdish, and a final revision.

**Clarifying deliverables**

The plan now includes two deliverables: an integrated plan with high-level notes and English content, followed by the final version in English, Arabic, and Kurdish.

**Deliverables overview**

We’re moving forward with two key deliverables: an integrated plan with high-level notes and English content, followed by the final version in English, Arabic, and Kurdish.

**Clarifying deliverables**

I’m mapping out the plan by integrating climate resilience into the curriculum, translating into Arabic and Kurdish, and finalizing the English version for a lump sum of 4 million IQD.

**Refining the plan**

## Work Plan & Timeline (Simplified)

**Project Duration**: January 21, 2025 – February 25, 2025 (Approximately 5 weeks)  
**Total Deliverables**: **2** major deliverables to minimize multiple feedback loops

### **Phase 1 (Week 1)**: Kickoff & Curriculum Review
- **Tasks**  
  1. **Kickoff Meeting**: Virtual meeting with Five One Labs to confirm scope and expectations.  
  2. **Curriculum Review**: Thoroughly analyze the existing Ignite and Incubator curriculum (32 sessions) to identify where and how climate resilience practices fit best.
  3. **Initial Outline Creation**: Develop a concise plan to integrate climate topics into the relevant sessions, with a focus on local (KRI) context + international best practices.

- **Deliverable 1**:  
  - **Climate Integration Outline (English)**  
    - A brief (5–6 pages max) overview specifying how each session can be enriched with climate resilience concepts, proposed adjustments, and resources.

---

### **Phase 2 (Weeks 2–3)**: Content Integration & Development (English)
- **Tasks**  
  1. **Build Out Climate Content**: Based on the approved outline, incorporate detailed climate-related materials into session notes, slides, and examples.  
  2. **Draft Trainer Materials**: Prepare trainer notes (in English) that include discussion prompts, case studies, and recommended resources.

- *Note*: During this phase, we’ll keep **checkpoints minimal**—for instance, **one mid-phase check-in** to confirm alignment before finalizing the English content.

---

### **Phase 3 (Weeks 4–5)**: Translation, Final Delivery & Handover
- **Tasks**  
  1. **Translation**: Convert all finalized English materials (slides, trainer notes, handouts) into **Arabic** and **Kurdish**.  
  2. **Quality Assurance**: Verify accuracy and consistency of climate-related terminology, ensuring cultural and linguistic appropriateness.  
  3. **Handover**: Provide a consolidated package of all finalized materials to Five One Labs via email or shared drive.

- **Deliverable 2**:  
  - **Complete Climate-Integrated Curriculum in English, Arabic, & Kurdish**  
    - One cohesive package containing slides, trainer notes, and references in **three languages**.

---

## Lump Sum Budget

Below is a streamlined cost proposal, inclusive of taxes, translations, and any overhead.  
   
| **Description**                     | **Cost (IQD)** |
|-------------------------------------|---------------:|
| **Phase 1**: Curriculum Review & Outline          |   1,000,000    |
| **Phase 2**: Content Integration (English)        |   1,500,000    |
| **Phase 3**: Translation (Arabic & Kurdish) + QA  |   1,200,000    |
| **TOTAL LUMP SUM**                               | **3,700,000 IQD** |

> **Note**:  
> - The above numbers are **indicative**. You may adjust them if you need to match a round figure up to 4,000,000 IQD.

---

## Payment Terms

- **One-Time Payment**: 100% payment upon successful delivery of **Deliverable 2** (the final, three-language curriculum package).  
- **Payment Method**: By **bank letter** or **bank transfer** as per Five One Labs’ preference, in **IQD**.  
- **Schedule**: Immediately upon final acceptance of materials (no later than February 25, 2025, unless otherwise agreed).

---

## Summary of the Simplified Plan

1. **Two Deliverables** Only
   - Deliverable 1: Climate Integration Outline (English)  
   - Deliverable 2: Final Materials in English, Arabic, Kurdish
2. **One-Time Payment** Post-Completion

This approach ensures a streamlined process with fewer rounds of feedback, helping meet your 4 million IQD budget cap and respecting Five One Labs’ preferred payment structure.

## Proposal for Climate Consultant Expert Services

### 1. Project Understanding
Five One Labs seeks to integrate climate resilience practices into its 32-session Incubator Program curriculum. This initiative will equip entrepreneurs in KRI with the knowledge to address local climate challenges while aligning with global sustainability goals.

---

### 2. Technical Approach & Methodology

#### Key Steps:
1. **Curriculum Review**  
   - Analyze all 32 sessions to identify opportunities for integrating climate resilience concepts.  
   - Draft a session-by-session outline with proposed enhancements.  

2. **Content Development**  
   - Create or adapt slides, trainer notes, and case studies in English, focusing on climate resilience and sustainability.  
   - Translate all materials into Arabic and Kurdish for accessibility.  

3. **Finalization & Handover**  
   - Refine materials based on feedback from Five One Labs.  
   - Provide a Trainer Guide with talking points and references.  
   - Conduct a final handover session to ensure smooth adoption.  

---

### 3. Work Plan & Timeline

**Duration**: January 21 – February 25, 2025 (5 weeks)

| **Step**                     | **Deliverables**                       | **Timeframe**       |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------|---------------------|
| **1. Curriculum Review**     | Climate Integration Outline            | Week 1–2           |
| **2. Content Development**   | Climate-Integrated Curriculum (English, Arabic, Kurdish) | Week 3–4           |
| **3. Finalization**           | Complete Curriculum Package + Handover Session | Week 5            |

---

### 4. Financial Bid

**Total Lump Sum**: **3,000,000 IQD**  
(Inclusive of all project expenses, translation, and taxes)

| **Step**                     | **Rate (IQD)** |
|-------------------------------|---------------:|
| Curriculum Review            |      1,000,000 |
| Content Development          |      1,500,000 |
| Finalization & Handover       |        500,000 |
| **Total**                    |  **3,000,000** |

---

### 5. Payment Terms

- **Schedule**: One-time payment upon completion of all deliverables (by February 25, 2025).  
- **Method**: Bank transfer or bank letter.  
- **Currency**: IQD (inclusive of taxes).  

---

### 6. Closing Statement

Thank you for considering this proposal. My goal is to provide a practical, impactful climate-focused curriculum that empowers entrepreneurs to create sustainable businesses in KRI. Please feel free to contact me for any questions or clarifications.

Sincerely,  
[Your Name]  
[Your Contact Information]  

---
